technologies.title: Apple Pay Web Merchant Registration API

content.text: Get in-depth information and UI resources for designing great apps that integrate seamlessly with Apple platforms.

abstract.text: Find and access identities, that is, users and groups. Display the Identity Picker, which lets users create and select identities.
Apply computer vision algorithms to perform a variety of tasks on input images and video.
Support peer-to-peer connectivity and the discovery of nearby devices.

Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.
Reduce fraudulent use of your services by managing device state and asserting app integrity.
Detect NFC tags, read messages that contain NDEF data, and save data to writable tags.
Build apps that leverage watchOS features like background tasks, extended runtime sessions, and access to the Digital Crown.
Access a low-level (libSystem) interprocess communication mechanism that is based on serialized property lists.
Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.

Create machine learning models for use in your app.
Control force feedback devices attached to the system. Develop plug-ins that enable communication with force feedback hardware.
Create network connections to send and receive data using transport and security protocols.
Push user-facing notifications to the users device from a server, or generate them locally from your app.

Harness the power of Quartz technology to perform lightweight 2D rendering with high-fidelity output. Handle path-based drawing, antialiased rendering, gradients, images, color management, PDF documents, and more.
Create tvOS client-server apps using web technologies to stream media and respond to events.
Manage the loading and unloading of system extensions in the kernel.
Provide apps with access to an advertising identifier.

Add sophisticated audio manipulation and processing capabilities to your app. Create audio unit extensions that generate or modify audio in a host app.
Find and play songs, audio podcasts, audio books, and more from within your app.

Provide user interface elements for security features such as authorization, access to digital certificates, and access to items in keychains.
Render advanced 3D graphics and perform data-parallel computations using graphics processors.
Discover, publish, and resolve network services on a local area or wide area network.
Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the users privacy and control.
Share hardware-accelerated buffer data (framebuffers and textures) across multiple processes. Manage image memory more efficiently.
Gain low-level access to the Objective-C runtime and the Objective-C root types.
Play, record, and process audio; configure your apps system audio behavior.
Perform computations on small vectors and matrices.
Create and manage OpenGL rendering contexts for use in macOS, and perform operations on drawable objects.

Create app extensions that allow users to send text, stickers, media files, and interactive messages.

Provide access from your web app to your CloudKit apps containers and databases.

Automate the tasks you perform on the Apple Developer website and in App Store Connect.
Prevent users from accessing specific system features during high-stakes assessment activities, such as administering an exam.
Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
Retrieve the properties of the media in the users iTunes library.
Play Live Photos on the web.
Reproduce colors accurately across a range of input, output, and display devices.
Monitor in-app purchase events in real time with server notifications from the App Store.
Build, test, and submit your app with Apples integrated development environment.

services, and read and modify
dictionaries from within an app.

Unified type information for files and data transfer.
Animate screen savers, and interact with the screen saver infrastructure. Use functions that help you produce random values and centering rectangles.

A function that finds the path to a macOS SDK version on disk.

Request the system to launch your app in the background to run tasks.
Access low-level functions, primitive data types, and various collection types that are bridged seamlessly with the Foundation framework.
Create extensions to manage and report unwanted SMS messages and spam calls.
Perform common application tasks.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
Allow applications to access a devices network configuration settings. Determine the reachability of the device, such as whether Wi-Fi or cell connectivity are active.

Coordinate the scheduling and synchronization of your apps tasks, and log information to the console to diagnose issues.

Help users access and manage their external accounts from within your app, without requiring them to enter login credentials.

Resources located in an app, framework, or plugin bundle.
Use specialized data types to interact with audio streams, complex buffers, and audiovisual timestamps.

Integrate web content seamlessly into your app, and customize content interactions to meet your apps needs.

Display content and descriptions, provide channel guides, and support multiple users on Apple TV.
Communicate with MIDI devices such as hardware keyboards and synthesizers.

Send audio and video to iOS, tvOS, and macOS devices.

Monitor and debug exceptional conditions in code.
Process accelerometer, gyroscope, pedometer, and environment-related events.

Evaluate JavaScript programs from within an app, and support JavaScript scripting of your app.
Extend the browsing experience with injected scripts and style sheets for web content, custom buttonsin the Safari toolbar, and contextual menuitems.
Support TV provider and Apple TV app functionality.
Speed up OpenGL ES or OpenGL app development. Use math libraries, background texture loading, pre-created shader effects, and a standard view and view controller to implement your rendering loop.
Customize and extend core networking features.
Share and manage web-usage data, and observe changes made by a parent or guardian.
Perform low-level file operations using type-safe APIs.
Execute code concurrently on multicore hardware by submitting work to dispatch queues managed by the system.

Build, compile, and execute customized multidimensional compute graphs for linear algebra, machine learning, computer vision, and other similar domains.
Create previews of files to use inside your app, or perform simple edits on previews.
Develop drivers for SCSI protocol-based devices.
Architect and organize your game logic.Incorporate common gameplay behaviors such as random number generation, artificial intelligence, pathfinding, and agent behavior.

Access network services and handle changes in network configurations. Build on abstractions of network protocols to simplify tasks such as working with BSD sockets, administering HTTP and FTP servers, and managing Bonjour services.
An extension other apps use to access files and folders managed by your app and synced with a remote storage.
Coordinate the presentation of closed-captioned data for your apps media files.

Authenticate users biometrically or with a passphrase they already know.
Post content to supported social networking services, using standard system interfaces.
Manage merchant registration through your web platform.

abstract.text: Integrate machine learning models into your app.

Create and run unit tests, performance tests, and UI tests for your Xcode project.

Use the Core Audio framework to interact with devices audio hardware.
Access hardware devices and drivers from your apps and services.

Create view-level services for media playback, complete with user controls, chapter navigation, and support for subtitles and closed captioning.

Browse for media devices and control them programmatically from your app.

Perform multithreaded lossless compression of directories, files, and data.

Render, compose, and animate visual elements.

Create a static image of a map from a URL.
Enable users to configure HomePod speakers to stream music directly from your media service.
Add graphics acceleration to your guest driver stack.

Use the iOS camera to scan documents like those you capture in the Notes app.
